result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristina J. LaFever was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Perform  40    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not have contact with Nicole R, Samantha J, Nicholas & Elizabeth J, unless otherwise permitted by the court - but DE may attend public functions at school.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Terminated on 10/14/17
Email correspondence received from Agent Ruhle advising DE has satisfied his court ordered financial obligations.
Email from DOC agent requesting a civil judgment for unpaid court obligations.
Probation review hearing on September 15, 2017 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Kristina J. LaFever, appeared with Attorney Donald J Bielski.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and case is resolved.  DE pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.  As a condition she is ordered to complete 40 hours of community service.  Court costs are ordered and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  No contact with Nicole R., Samantha J., Nicholas J or Elizabeth J. unless permitted by the court only.  DE may attend public functions at the school.  Appeal Rights given.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 4/14/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 4/18/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Donald Bielski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  FPT adj. to 1/21/16 at 9:00, to allow Atty Bielski time to talk to ADA Jessica Krejcarek, who charged the case and the co-def. case that is pending in Br. 6.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
